Package simpleGUI

Class Window

java.lang.Object
simpleGUI.Window
public class Window extends Object
Functions as a root when building the GUI.

  • Constructor Details

    • Window

      public Window()
      Constructor. Create an empty window without a Frame. Width and height is by default 500x500px.

    • Window

      public Window(String title)
      Constructor. Create an empty window without a Frame. Width and height is by default 500x500px.
      Parameters:
      title - The window title.

    • Window

      public Window(String title, int heightInPixels, int widthInPixels)
      Constructor. Create an empty window without a Frame.
      Parameters:
      title - Set the title of the window.
      heightInPixels - Set the height of the window in pixels.
      widthInPixels - Set the width of the window in pixels.

    • Window

      public Window(int heightInPixels, int widthInPixels)
      Constructor. Create an empty window without a Frame.
      Parameters:
      heightInPixels - Set the height of the window in pixels.
      widthInPixels - Set the width of the window in pixels.

  • Method Details

    • setHeight

      public void setHeight(int heightInPixels)
      Set the window height.
      Parameters:
      heightInPixels - Set the height of the window in pixels.

    • setWidth

      public void setWidth(int widthInPixels)
      Set the window width.
      Parameters:
      widthInPixels - Set the width of the window in pixels.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int widthInPixels, int heightInPixels)
      Set the window width and height.
      Parameters:
      widthInPixels - Set the width of the window in pixels.
      heightInPixels - Set the height of the window in pixels.

    • build

      public void build()
      Build the components of the window, making it visible as an application.

    • addFrame

      public Frame addFrame()
      Add a new frame to the window, to a maximum of four frames. When a second frame is added it will split the available space vertical, and place itself to the right of the first. Third is placed on the bottom, and fourth will split the bottom and place itself bottom right.
      Returns:
      new Frame

    • getFrame

      public Frame getFrame()
      Returns:
      The Frame attached to the Window.

    • addScrollbar

      public Scrollbar addScrollbar()
      Add a scrollbar that by default is placed on the right of the window, with vertical scrolling.
      Returns:
      new Scrollbar

    • addScrollbar

      public Scrollbar addScrollbar(boolean alwaysShowVertical, boolean alwaysShowHorizontal)
      Add a scrollbar that by default is placed on the right of the window, with vertical scrolling.
      Parameters:
      alwaysShowVertical - Set the vertical scrollbar to always visible if true, and if needed when false.
      alwaysShowHorizontal - Set the horizontal scrollbar to always visible if true, and if needed when false.
      Returns:
      new Scrollbar

    • scrollbar

      public Scrollbar scrollbar()
      Return the scrollbar attached to the window.
      Returns:
      Scrollbar

    • addNavigationBar

      public NavigationBar addNavigationBar()
      Add a NavigationBar to the window that by default is placed horizontal at the top of the window.
      Returns:
      new NavigationBar

    • navigationBar

      public NavigationBar navigationBar()
      Return the NavigationBar attached to the window.
      Returns:
      NavigationBar
